latest news.eng_title: Gold Price Breaks Historic Record: What's Behind the Surge
latest news.summary: The price of gold exceeded $2560 per ounce on Friday, setting a new historical record, according to Trading Economics. This was due to the weakening of the US dollar and the decrease in government bond yields, as well as the latest economic data, which strengthened expectations of more aggressive actions from the Federal Reserve. September futures for gold on the Comex exchange are trading at around $2568 per ounce, a 0.4% increase from the previous session's close. Analysts at Goldman Sachs Research predict that the precious metal may reach $2700 per ounce by early 2025, driven by lower US interest rates and demand for gold from central banks in emerging markets, as they said, 'due to the decrease in US interest rates and demand for gold from central banks in emerging markets.'
latest news.title: Цена золота обновила исторический максимум: какова причина

latest news.eng_title: Gold Price Reaches Historic High of $2600.9 per Ounce
latest news.summary: The price of gold has reached a historic high of $2600.9 per ounce, according to data from the Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME). This represents a 23% increase in value since the beginning of the year. Bloomberg reports that the rally in gold prices is due to several factors, including investor expectations of a decrease in US Federal Reserve interest rates, as well as geopolitical tensions in the Middle East and Eastern Europe, which have increased demand for safe-haven assets. 'We are moving towards a environment with lower interest rates, making gold much more attractive,' said Alex Ebkarian, Chief Operating Officer of Allegiance Gold. Experts recommend considering gold and bonds for diversification, but warn of potential risks when buying stocks, which can either generate profits or lose value.
latest news.title: Цена золота взлетела до исторического максимума

latest news.eng_title: Gold Futures Reach Historical Maximum, Surpassing $2,600 per Ounce
latest news.summary: The price of gold futures on the Comex exchange reached a historical maximum of $2,601 per troy ounce, surpassing $2,600. According to TASS, as of 12:28 Moscow time, gold was trading at $2,600.9 per troy ounce, and by 12:41 Moscow time, it accelerated its growth to $2,601 per ounce. This marks a 2.11% increase from the end of the trading session on September 12, when gold futures rose to $2,596 per troy ounce. Meanwhile, the price of Brent crude oil futures with November delivery on London's ICE reached $72.68 (+0.62%).
latest news.title: Price of gold futures on Comex updates historical maximum, surpassing $2,600 per ounce

latest news.eng_title: Gold Price Surpasses $2600 per Ounce for the First Time
latest news.summary: The price of gold on the stock exchange has exceeded $2600 per ounce for the first time in history. According to trading data, the price of the December gold futures contract on the New York Comex exchange has risen by 0.71% to $2599.05 per ounce, with a maximum value of $2600.75 per ounce. The price of the December silver futures contract has also risen by 1.26% to $30.485 per ounce.
latest news.title: Биржевая цена на золото превысила 2600 долларов за тройскую унцию

latest news.eng_title: Gold Reaches Historic High at $2,570 per Ounce
latest news.summary: The price of gold, which started the day with an increase, is currently trading at $2,570 per ounce, a historic high. This is after reaching a record closing price of $2,558 per ounce yesterday. The price of gold in grams has also increased by 1.6% compared to the previous day's closing price, reaching $2,789. Analysts expect the price of gold to continue to rise, with technical resistance levels at $2,580 and $2,600 per ounce, and support levels at $2,550 and $2,530 per ounce. The current market sentiment is mixed, with expectations of a 25 basis point interest rate cut by the US Federal Reserve this month, and a 100 basis point cut by the end of the year. 'The soft landing' expectations have increased, reducing the risk perception, following the release of the US Producer Price Index (PPI) data yesterday.
latest news.title: Altında yeni rekor!

latest news.source_id: جـ ر يـ د ة ا لـ ر يـ ا ض
latest news.summary: Gold prices rose to an all-time high today, increasing by 0.4% to $2567.99 per ounce in the spot market by 05:01 GMT, after reaching an all-time high of $2570.03 earlier in the session. The precious metal has risen by nearly 3% since the start of the week. Meanwhile, US gold futures contracts rose by 0.6% to $2596.20.
latest news.title: ارتفاع أسعار الذهب لأعلى مستوى على الإطلاق

latest news.eng_title: Gold Price Surpasses $2580 Per Ounce for the First Time
latest news.summary: The price of gold futures has exceeded $2580 per ounce for the first time, according to trading data. The most traded December gold futures contract on the Comex exchange (a subsidiary of the New York Mercantile Exchange) rose by 1.6% to $2583.6 per ounce at 18:07 Moscow time. Spot gold was trading at $2554.4 (+1.7%) at the same time. It is worth noting that the price of gold futures first exceeded $2,500 on August 1, while spot gold did so on August 16. Since the beginning of the year, the precious metal has risen by nearly 20%, and over the past 12 months, it has increased by more than 26%. The growth continues due to rising geopolitical concerns and expectations of a decrease in the US Federal Reserve's interest rate on September 17. These concerns were further exacerbated after the US Labor Department announced a slowdown in annual inflation in the country to 2.5% in August (the lowest since February 2021). Additionally, the US Labor Department released data on the growth of unemployment benefit applications for the first week of September, which rose by 230,000, in line with analysts' forecasts. Furthermore, the European Central Bank (ECB) has also decided to lower interest rates. 'The combination of data on the ECB's interest rate cut, a small increase in unemployment benefit applications, and the consumer price index was enough to push gold to a new record high,' said Ole Hansen, head of commodity strategy at Saxo Bank, as reported by Bloomberg.
latest news.title: Цена фьючерса на золото впервые превысила $2580 за унцию

latest news.eng_title: Gold Prices Rise as US Inflation Data is Released
latest news.summary: As of 12:10 Moscow time, the gold futures contracts (Comex) rose by 0.11% to $2,545.20 per ounce, while the gold spot contracts increased by 0.27% to $2,518.58 per ounce. The gold futures contracts stabilized at $2,542.40 per ounce after the release of US inflation data, which showed a slowdown in US inflation in August, but the core inflation index came in below expectations. The US inflation rate slowed down to 2.5% on an annual basis in August, in line with expert expectations, and lower than the previous month (July 2024) when it was 2.9% on an annual basis. However, the core inflation index, which excludes food and energy prices, rose by 0.3% in August, exceeding expectations of a 0.2% increase, and on an annual basis, the index stood at 3.2%.
latest news.title: ارتفاع أسعار الذهب والأسواق تنتظر بيانات أمريكية

news knowledge.eng_title: Gold Prices Rise as US Dollar Index Falls
news knowledge.summary: As of 10:20 Moscow time, the Comex gold futures contracts were traded at $2548.20 per ounce, an increase of 0.20% from the previous settlement price. The spot gold was traded at $2519.13 per ounce, an increase of 0.09% from the previous close, according to data from 'Bloomberg'. The gold price rise coincided with a decline in the US dollar index, which measures the value of the US dollar against a basket of major currencies, by 0.18% to 100.9240 dollars per ounce.
news knowledge.title: ارتفاع أسعار الذهب مع تراجع الدولار

news knowledge.eng_title: Comex Gold Settles 0.92% Higher at $2525.70 — Data Talk
news knowledge.summary: Comex gold for September delivery rose by $23.10 per troy ounce, or 0.92%, to a new record high of $2525.70 today, marking the largest one-day dollar and percentage gain since August 23, 2024. This gain snaps a two-session losing streak and is up 39.03% from its 52-week low of $1816.60 hit on October 5, 2023. The metal has also risen 30.31% from 52 weeks ago and 26.90% from its 2024 settlement low of $1990.30 hit on February 14, 2024. Month-to-date, it is up 4.09%, and year-to-date, it is up $463.30 or 22.46%.
news knowledge.title: Comex Gold Settles 0.92% Higher at $2525.70 — Data Talk

news knowledge.eng_title: Gold Spot Price Remains Stable at $2,516.79 per Ounce
news knowledge.summary: The gold spot price has remained relatively stable, trading at $2,516.79 per ounce with a 0.05% decline. The December Comex gold price has also remained stable, trading at $2,546.50 per ounce with a 0.01% increase. The gold spot price in euros is trading at €2,508 per ounce with a 0.15% decline, while the December Comex gold price is trading at €2,537.60 per ounce with a 0.15% decline. The gold spot price in dollars is trading at $2,497.84 per ounce with a 0.26% decline, while the December Comex gold price is trading at $2,537.60 per ounce with a 0.15% decline. According to recent data, the US, Germany, and Italy have the largest gold reserves, while countries such as Russia, China, and Turkey have increased their gold reserves in recent years as part of their efforts to de-dollarize their economies.
news knowledge.title: Prezzo oro spot poco mosso spot a 2 51679 dollari

news knowledge.eng_title: Gold Prices End Gains, Decline Amid Dollar Rise
news knowledge.summary: Gold prices have ended a series of gains, with the Comex contracts falling 0.48% to $2535.20 per ounce by 15:20 Moscow time, and the spot contracts falling 0.38% to $2503 per ounce. Yesterday, the Comex contracts for the yellow metal fell 0.1% to $2547.5 per ounce, according to data from 'Bloomberg'. The metal's prices have given up the historical levels it reached earlier in the week, exceeding $2550 per ounce. The decline comes as the US dollar index, which measures the value of the US dollar against a basket of major currencies, rose 0.31% to 101.3540 points.
news knowledge.title: الذهب ينهي سلسلة من المكاسب

news knowledge.eng_title: Gold Prices Continue to Rise, Surpassing $2550 per Ounce
news knowledge.summary: Gold prices continued to rise in today's trading, following yesterday's historic high where it surpassed $2550 per ounce. The Comex gold futures rose by 0.11% to $2553.30 per ounce, while the spot gold fell to $2513.93 per ounce. The gold futures stabilized at $30 per ounce with a 0.16% increase from the previous close, according to data from Bloomberg. Yesterday, gold prices reached a historic high of $2550.6 per ounce, supported by the dollar's decline and growing market confidence in the possibility of a US interest rate cut next month.

news knowledge.eng_title: Gold Price Surpasses $2560 per Ounce for the First Time
news knowledge.summary: The price of gold on the Comex exchange has broken its historical record, reaching $2563.9 (+0.89%) per ounce at 15:18 MSK. However, the price later decreased to $2549.7 (+0.33%) per ounce at 20:51 MSK. According to Bloomberg, the price of gold has increased by over 20% since the beginning of 2024, and is expected to continue growing due to expectations of a decrease in the US Federal Reserve's interest rate. As stated by Bloomberg, 'gold will continue to rise throughout the year.'
news knowledge.title: Цена золота впервые превысила $2560 за унцию

news knowledge.eng_title: Gold Prices Surge Above $2500 per Ounce
news knowledge.summary: The spot price of gold on Monday, August 19, is trading above the historic mark of $2500 per ounce, which was first exceeded last Friday. At 12:30 Moscow time, the price of the precious metal is $2502.2 per ounce. The December futures contract on the Comex exchange (a subsidiary of the New York Mercantile Exchange) is trading at $2541.4 per ounce. As a reminder, the price of gold futures first broke through the $2,500 barrier on August 1. Goldman Sachs expects gold to reach $2700 in 2025, while Citigroup predicts a price range of $2700-$3000. Gold has risen by over 20% since the beginning of the year and continues to rise on expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut in September. These expectations have been strengthened after the regulator maintained the rate at 5.25-5.5% for the eighth time in a row yesterday.
news knowledge.title: Золото торгуется выше исторических $2500 за унцию

news knowledge.eng_title: Gold Price Hits New Record High at COMEX
news knowledge.summary: The gold price at the COMEX reached a new record high today, rising to $2,523 per ounce. According to data from the trading platform, the price peaked at $2,538.7 per ounce, a 1.86% increase. However, prices later fell to $2,528 per ounce, still a 1.53% increase. The COMEX is the world's largest trading platform for gold futures, and is a subsidiary of the Chicago Mercantile Exchange. As 'Commodity Exchange', it trades not only gold but also other metals like silver, aluminum, and copper. As reported by TASS, Retroreisen offers customized and personalized travel experiences, focusing on sustainability, fair travel, and slow food.
news knowledge.title: Goldpreis an der COMEX heute Morgen auf Allzeithoch

news knowledge.eng_title: Gold Prices Reach Record High, Exceeding $2506.2 per Ounce
news knowledge.summary: Gold prices have reached a record high, exceeding $2506.2 per ounce, due to increased demand from investors seeking safe-haven assets. According to MarketWatch, gold futures on the Comex exchange have risen by 1%. Chris Weston, head of research at Pepperstone, said, 'For gold, the wind is at its back.' He believes that expectations of a dovish Fed have reached a point where discussions are now centered around the need for a more significant rate cut in September. The growing tensions in the Middle East have made gold the most popular asset for risk hedging, while the reduction of import duties on gold in India is also expected to increase demand for the precious metal.
news knowledge.title: Золото подорожало до рекорда, превысило $2500 за унцию

news knowledge.summary: The price of gold exceeded $2500 per ounce for the first time, due to the decision of the Federal Reserve to maintain the key interest rate and the rise of geopolitical risks. According to trading data, the price of the December gold futures contract on the New York Comex exchange increased by 0.7%, reaching $2490.2 per ounce. The September silver futures contract also rose, with a gain of 0.43%, to $29.062 per ounce. As one observer noted, 'The current market conditions are a reflection of the uncertainty and instability in the global economy.'
news knowledge.title: Цена золота впервые превысила $2500 за унцию
